channel.title: Saddle Documentation on SADDLE
channel.description: Recent content in Saddle Documentation on SADDLE

item.title: Getting started
item.description: Add any of these lines to your build.sbt: // The core library libraryDependencies += "io.github.pityka" % "saddle-core" % "0.0.0+1-368730bb-SNAPSHOT" // Inlined binary operation instances for Mat and Vec libraryDependencies += "io.github.pityka" % "saddle-ops-inlined" % "0.0.0+1-368730bb-SNAPSHOT" // Linear algebra interface to BLAS libraryDependencies += "io.github.pityka" % "saddle-linalg" % "0.0.0+1-368730bb-SNAPSHOT" // Binary representation of data frames and matrices libraryDependencies += "io.github.pityka" % "saddle-binary" % "0.0.0+1-368730bb-SNAPSHOT" // Circe Encoder and Decoder instances libraryDependencies += "io.

item.title: Usage
item.description: Imports You most likely need the following two imports: import org.saddle._ import org.saddle.order._ Note that org.saddle.order._ imports cats.kernel.Order[_] typeclass instances into the scope. If you import cats instances an other way then you should not import org.saddle.order._. The Order[Double] and Order[Float] instances in org.saddle.order define a total ordering and order NaN above all other values, consistent with java.lang.Double.compare. 1D vector: Vec[T] Factories: import org.saddle._ Vec(1, 2, 3) // res0: Vec[Int] = [3 x 1] // 1 // 2 // 3 // Vec(1 to 3 : _*) // res1: Vec[Int] = [3 x 1] // 1 // 2 // 3 // Vec(Array(1,2,3)) // res2: Vec[Int] = [3 x 1] // 1 // 2 // 3 // Vec.
